page.title: 13Recreation in our District.
page.content: In the districts of Olveston and Tockington the forms of recreation for the young are two brownie packs,one guide company, one scout group and one cub pack plus a youth club at Tockington village hall.Tockington village hall contributes a great many of the opportunities for recreation locally.The hall was opened in 1901 and at the present is being looked after by Mrs Bennett. Many people use the hall facilities such as youth clubs,drama,keep fit,toddler and play groups as well as being used for local and national elections. There are good cooking facilities a piano and stage in the hall. The hall is also used by the Olveston and Tockington Sunday school once a year for their Christmas party and Olveston school for their annual school play.
